data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3474816,"name":"4391 Programming Mentor","username":"aveeser","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/3da27b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-08T01:50:33.228Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWe have a limelight 3 and are using it with a google coral to do object detection.  We’re just detecting a note from last years game and all that works great but we seem to be locked in at around 30fps no matter what resolution we use, or image cropping or anything.  We were wanting to get a faster frame rate going in the event we wanted to use this hardware to literally chase down a quick moving object.  30fps probably wont be fast enough for what we want to accomplish.   Are we missing some adjustment somewhere that could allow us to speed the frame rate up?
